name: Banco Metropolitano ATM
description: ATM in Havana centro. It ONLY accepts VISA. NO Mastercard!

name: Panamericana Mercado
description: 5 liters jar for 1.90 CUC (or 1.90 USD). By far the cheapest bottled water you can find in Havana!

name: Correos De Cuba/ Post Office & CADECA (foreign Exchange)
description: Post office in Havana Vieja (Old Havana). (You dont need stamp for postcards. Its included in the price. We paid 1 CUC (or 1 USD) for one postcard including the stamp.) Also, there is a foreign exchange bureau just across (CADECA/ Casa De Cambio). Be aware when you exchange US Dollars. They deduct a 10% plus the exchange rate (check the picture). Prefer EURO, Canadian dollars or Mexican Pesos.

name: FREE WIFI
description: FREE WIFI in Cuba!!! Deadly slow! Forget about social media or streaming! You just need patience! Ask for the password from the locals. We never managed to send/ reply to our emails. No skype also. We just managed to connect ;-)

name: La Juliana
description: Pizza, pasta, sandwich and COCA COLA in Cuba!! One sandwich & one pizza 3,5 euro (90 cup). Its an Oasis of cheap & quality food in Havana. Forget about the 10 pesos food and come here for breakfast/ lunch/ dinner! Its worthwhile to visit this place and experience the slow (or fast? You decide) transformation of communist & authentic Cuba to a capitalist modern economy similar to its neighbors (US & Mexico). All prices are in Pesos Cubanos/ Moneda Nacional. The exchange rate is 1 CUC (tourist currency) for 24 CUP (Moneda Nacional). Off course they accept CUC.

name: Wifi Hotspot Havana Centro
description: Buy your ETESCA card from someone around and surf on the web in Cuba!! You pay 3 CUC (or 3 USD) for 1 hour. Normally, ETESCA sells for 2 CUC if you manage to buy from an official store. Dont expect great speed. Forget about FB, streaming etc. Skype works ok.

name: Wifi Hotspot Viñales
description: Buy your ETECSA card and surf here. Its a nice busy kiosk with picnic tables. There is also a nice store/bar to buy drinks, alcohol or snacks.

name: Da'Tuty Bar & Restaurant
description: Nice restaurant in Viñales with reasonable prices. We ordered arroz mixto, artoz a la cubana & ropa vieja. All were nicely cooked. Good service also. Good prices compared to most of the touristic restaurants in Viñales.

name: Valley De Viñales Viewpoint & Tourist Info Centre
description: Stunning views of the valley just before enter to the little town of Viñales. The building hosts also the tourist centre of the Valley de Viñales National Park from where you can get useful info about the area & the National Park, read about the history and check some trails.

name: Los Jazmines Hotel Mirador
description: Excellent place to catch stunning views of the Viñales Valley. You can have lunch/ beers at the bar of the hotel also. 3 CUC if you want to swim in the pool. In a busy day (especially during weekends) dont bother. Just go in & jump in the pool! Nobody will notice. Its a public hotel so dont expect the service to be fast or good! Everything is slow. There is also WIFI (they sell ETECSA cards). If you want to stay, get prepared to splash the cash!!!!

name: Horse-back Riding In Viñales Valley
description: Jose is doing horse back riding in the Viñales Valley. You will visit a tobacco farm, a coffee plantation/farm and a cave where you can swim (its 2 CUC extra for getting into the cave). The cost is 10 CUC per person. The tour lasts 4-6 hours. Jose is a great guide, he is very experienced with horses & we had a great time. The activity is very good value for your money & the landscape is stunning. You can also buy cigars from the tobacco farm for 3 CUC per piece. You will also have the chance to try the cigar before shopping. The cigars are super nice. Jose rents casas & he also rents bicycles. The location of the place is his house. Its a two floors white-blue building. Just ask for Jose (or Pupito). Jose's house is in the basement (first on your right).

name: Los Cocos Beach - Playa Giron
description: If -for a reason- you end up to Playa Giron, since there is anything else to do, you can pay a visit to Los Cocos beach. Nice sandy beach, a bit rocky as you walk in with coconut trees in line. There are also some tiendas who sell stuff (souvenirs, summer hats, drinks etc). If you think its a typical Caribbean exotic beach, you are absolutely wrong!

name: CADECA/ Bus Station/ Grocery Store
description: A little complex that hosts most of the basics for travelers in the little town of Playa Giron. An exchange bureau (CADECA), a small grocery store (alcohol, cigarettes, some food etc) and the central Viazul bus station. Remember: book in advance for any destination (Cienfuegos, Trinidad, Varadero, Havana) as it gets too crowded in the morning.

name: CADECA Cienfuegos
description: CADECA (government run exchange bureau) in Cienfuegos city centre. Expect long queues (as usual).

name: Restaurant Inside Mercado Artesanias
description: A little hidden gem inside the Mercado Artesanias in Calle 54 (the main paseo in Cienfuegos). Just across Restaurant "La Verja", go inside the mercado and look for the little restaurant. It does not look great at the first sight but food is awesome and dirty cheap. Really big portions, good service and tasty cuban food. We had fish, ropa vieja (a cuban classic) and  mixta (including 4 soft drinks, we paid 205 cup for 4 people). All were delicious. Dont miss it when you are in Cienfuegos! Highly recommended.

name: Playa Ancon
description: The place to be in Trinidad. Take the bus from the town (4 cuc return ticket pp) and spend your day in Carribean! Lots of places for drinks and food around!

name: Wifi Hotspot Trinidad
description: Buy your ETECSA card and surf! Excellent place for socializing as well. Free live music shows at night.

name: Casa Cary Y Lazaro
description: Casa particulare in the city centre. Has everything (AC, hot water, kitchen, privacy) and its location is super. They usually charge 25 CUC. Bargain hard. We paid 20 CUC per night. If they ask if its your first time, say no and pretend that you know the price range.

name: La Borla TRD CARIBE
description: Cheap water in Havana Centro. 0,45 CUC for 500ml, 0,70 CUC for 1,5lt & 1,90 CUC for 5lt.

name: Soda Obispo Helados (Ice Creams)
description: Best & cheapest ice cream in Havana. Dont miss the coconut (coco glasé). You pay in CUP.

name: Hostal Elena
description: Excellent Cuban hospitality by a lovely family. Great colonial building with all the basic amenities you can find in Cuban houses (A/C, hot water, power). They also provided us with filtered water to drink for free and they let us make use of their kitchen. Only two blocks from the main avenue of Cienfuegos and less than 10 min walk from the main plaza. We paid 35 CUC for a room (we were 4 people). If you bargain, she will let you stay for 17-18 CUC for a couple. Recommended!

name: Immigration
description:
Get your Touristcard extension here

Bring:
25 CUC in sellos (you get them at a bank)
old tarjeta turistica (must be expired!)
Confirmation of your next night at a casa or hotel
Passport

name: Casa Azul
description: This Casa is about10 minutes walking from center. There is terrace, relaxing at terrace was amazing. Hot shower, air conditioner, fan, refrigerator, TV. I stay here 3 nights, room is 12 CUC, breakfast is 3 CUC, dinner is 4 CUC. Food are very delicious. If you stay only 1 night, price is more high maybe. If you are 2 people, price is more low maybe. Owner Maira is very nice lady. She speaks only Spanish but she is used to meet foreigners who don't understand Spanish.

name: Casa de Emma
description:
Home stay style accommodation. There are 2 rooms, each room have 2 beds. Room are simple but very clean. For 1 parson is 10 CUC. Price is include breakfast. Dinner is 5 CUC. Emma is very kind and wonderful cook.
Baracoa is not too much touristic, sea and mountains are beautiful. Baracoa is NO.1 town of Cuba for me.

name: Villa Colón, Casa Particular
description:
Nice casa particular with 3 rooms, for max. 6 people, newly renovated (last steps in progress, A/C planned). Very friendly, English speaking hosts. We were 2 persons and paid 35 CUC pn for the whole house. 
Breakfast and great local dinner at their friend's house next to Villa Colón. Be open! Its the simplest hut, but Roberto is the most warm-hearted cook. His tortilla is unique and dinner with fish, octopus really great. 400 m from the Caribbean beach. White sand, blue water, almost no people.

name: Salto del Guiabol (highest waterfall on Cuba)
description:
5cuc entrance fee, can see one slightly smaller waterfall from restaurant without paying entrance. i did not enter but heard it's nice, you have to hike to the bottom to see it, swimming in the pools possible (get out of your riding gear).

the road from Mella to here is loose gravel with big stones, not the best, down to Mayari is good dirt.

name: beachcamp next to bucanero bar
description:
the bar closes around 6pm and there is a guard staying all night who also looks for your bike if you decide to go for a walk.
everyone is super nice here and they say it would be no problem to camp here.
had a nice quiet night, even in daytime there is not much going on, it's beautiful, highly recommend.

there is a 24h restaurant with excellent food for ~5cuc, 5min walk direction la boca, if you walk along the beach you can't miss it.

name: Abandoned
description: Abandoned place. Camping free directly at the beach. No infrastructure. Ocean water is clean. Looks like a place where couples go to have some time together.

name: playa ancon beach camp
description:
best to make friends with the security as early as possible, went for a swim and for a "small" tip (1cuc) he allowed me to use the outdoor shower of the adjacent resort.
i also paid 1cuc for parking till people had left...

name: Playa Giron Camp
description:
another nice beach camp with cocktail/beer supply till ~6pm. beachguards and bar guys are really cool, deliver drinks, get food (from somewhere else), cut down coconuts from the palm trees as needed and are generally very friendly. 
there is lots of grass around for camping. quiet night.

name: Cueva de los peces
description:
i'm not sure what the guidebook says, but there is some really nice snorkelling around here, best to bring your own gear and be here before 9 (it gets really crowded around 10am).
snorkel/diving rental opens at 9-9:30.

nice shipwreck if you swim out straight just before it gets really deep to your right.

if you worry about getting into your riding gear with sticky saltwater, there is a beautiful natural freshwater-pool next to the restaurant (which i think serves things like crocodile).

really good place, many beautiful places for camping along this road.

name: Marina fuel
description:
this is the very end of the road, there is a small marina and a locked pump for boats, they have especial and diesel.
i had to personally pick up the fuel guy from las tumbas to get fuel here. easier you fill up in Sandino. there is also a bar which serves drinks (pricey).

name: Guanahacabibes National Park
description:
entrance gate to national park.
very nice ride to the western end of Cuba.
better ride slow, many animals crossing this road, pig families, iguanas, birds, huge crabs, horses and cows.
some great spots to camp near the beach, not 100% sure it's permitted (the manager of las tumbas hotel said it's not) but rangers found me around 7pm standing next to my tent, waved hello and left. some spots have wooden shelters (seem to be made for camping)

there is a shipwreck close to the road too, you can't miss it...

i can't say if there is an entrance fee as i took a short dirtroad into the park circumventing the gate, when i left through the gate (ready to pay) they asked for my permit and just let me go without...

name: wooden shelter
description: very nice place to camp, hard ground to park the bike and sheltered spot to put up a tent. many seating/cooking options. pigs might visit. there is an old man living nearby (the house to the west) who might come over as well. he didn't talk much, maybe he is the caretaker of this spot and expected some money, but he didn't say. i left a tip.

name: María La Gorda
description:
hotel and diving center.
5cuc to spend the day in the compound
7cuc for snorkeling gear
12cuc for snorkeling boat trip
63s/85d for a room
has wifi, food, bar
i just rented gear and snorkelled from the beach, enjoyable but nothing spectacular, i think the diving trips are good though.

name: hostal el jardin
description: 20cuc in high season, garage with space for two bikes, nice family and big room with attached roof terrace. 5 small lazy dogs.

name: Place at the ocean
description: Incredible nice place at the ocean. Big rocks and lot,s of fisherman. The street from the east is pure adventure for motorbike riders. Good sleep. Safe. Also worth a short visit. Good swimmers can have a lot of fun...

name: bike importation/exportation
description:
blue building at the window.
for exportation bring a 5cuc stamp. they will take engine and chassis number (again). 
importation expect one full day, exportation a few hours.

name: Hostal Sra. Maylan
description: Very nice hostel with huge garage. place for at least 6 motorbikes. Right now they can host 3 people but they a building more rooms. The lady of the house is super friendly and you shouldn't miss her food. You can wash your motorbike in the garage if you like. Perfect spot if you are leaving Cuba from Cienfuegos since it's just 60km away... Highly recommended.

name: Maritza Rent Room
description:
This a guest houst located at about 2 km from La Habana Vieja. You feel in the heart of The true city, you live in a family house very friendly and helpful.   When we arrived the house was full but Maritza has many links in neiborough and she found another family (Elvira) that could rent a room for us, a few meters further. 
We paid 30€ for a double with bathroom and shared saloon and kitchen. Everything very clean. 
Possibilty to have breakfast at Maritza's for 4€/pers. 
A good place to stay in La Habana.

name: Jazz Cafe Trinidad
description:
buffet and a main course for cheap in this restaurant located in the heart of Centro Historico. 
Price : 7.50 CUC if meat as main course
Or 11 CUC if you choose as main course the grilled lobster tail (Big and delicious). 
In the free buffet you can find : rice, beans, raw vegetables, chips, squash and fruits (pineapple, papaya).

name: Taxi driver with old Pontiac in Cienfuegos
description:
His name is David Pérez he drives a magnificent ancient Pontiac from 1959 and practices good prices to ride from a town to another. 
We paid 25 CUC (for 2 of us) from Trinidad to Cienfuegos. 
He can drive you everywhere in Cuba. 
From Cienfuegos to Viñales he charged 100 CUC (420 km).
Phone cell : 0143579038

name: Terminal Connection Bus - Almost Free Airport Travel
description:
To get to Havana City or back to the Airport for 2pesos (2cup), yes literally about 6cents.

1. From Airport take terminal bus to this location cost 1peso.

2. Use Maps.me and walk to the terminal 2 bus station (image attached)

3. Catch the P12 bus it is squishy and takes about 1hour but this bus with cost another 1peso (3cents)

4. Get off at Parque El Curita (corner of Dragones and Águila) you are now right in Old Havana about 200metres from the National Capital

Follow the directions in Reverse to get back to the Aiport, somone has already pinned the park / location of the P12 bus in the city.

This saves you 35USD each way. 

Heads up 1cuc = 24cup = 90cents USD

Enjoy

name: casa galicia (maximiliano ramos 112 street)
description: colonial house. very clean, friendly. you can park the car. we paid 15cuc and we park the car inside. very close of centrum. you can breakfast for a few money. with a patio inside they do some times mojitos in the patio.

name: hostal Elida
description: clean, nice and family very friendly. we paid 12cuc but it was low season and after the Irma hurricaine.

name: La Lonja
description:
Cool simple bar with outdoor seatings. Very very cheap! The prices are in CUP but in can pay in CUC (1 CUP = 1 CUC). Nice and polite staff (how difficult is to find this in Cuba). Beer costs 35 CUP (1,40 CUP), Cheese Sandwich 25 CUP (1 CUC), Pork Sandwich 25 CUP (1 CUC).
Maind dishes around 80 CUP (3,20 CUC).
Nice place to stop for a beer!

name: Free wifi access point
description: weird...but free wifi in this little square. there s also a small restaurant with a horseshoe table setting. paid 2 cuc with fresh tamarindo juice

name: Cristina casa particular
description:
I arrived late in Havana and had to leave the next morning. useless to go back to Havana city and then pay 25cuc for a taxi in the morning, so I stayed in this nice house. 20 per night (but maybe you can work your way towards 15) with air-conditioning and private bathroom. single room. Cristina is very helpful and friendly.
nearby there are few food stalls where you can eat with 1.5cuc a huge meal with fresh juice.
walking distance to the airport. follow maps.me and you ll get there in 45 min.
there are also fancier options in the area too for 30-40 a night.

name: Leyanis y Jesus A.
description: Nice spot with view in the valley. Price 15 CUC per night/room

name: Shipwreck
description: Massive Shipwreck in the Sea, amazing! Would be cool to explore i guess. Entry to national park free and without problem if you speak a bit spanish and tell you want to come to take pictures. Hard to miss!

name: Family house
description:
It´s a house with 2 floors. In the first floor there is a kitchen, bathroom and a room with a really big mattress (2m), and A/C and fridge. In the 2 floor there is a room and a bathroom with A/C and fridge.
 You can rent just one floor. Belongs to a really honest and nice family, nice conversations with them. 15 minutes walk to the beach. 
Near the house you have a lot of restaurants ( la cocinita de yumi and super Mochis are delicious). 
Ask for Arley, the color of the house is dark red and creamy.

name: Casa señora Miriam
description: This is Miriam´s house. Has 3 rooms with toilet and A/C. Is about 2,5 km from the center. Miriam is a really good cooker.

name: Niuka's house
description: This is Niuka's house. The house has a room with two big beds. The family is really honest and friendly. We did a laundry there. We felt like at home with this family.

name: Casa Conte
description:
This is the house from Eric and Yemney, they are a really nice couple, nice conversations with them. The house has 2 rooms with a double bed, bathroom and A/C. 
Also they have a small house that you can rent with kitchen, a bedroom and a bathroom.
 There is a nice terrace. They make good breakfast for 5 CUC.

name: Milagros y Yamile
description: Room with 2 double beds with toilet inside and fridge. Milagros and Yumile are a very nice womans. I really recommend this people. Telephone number is +5353311915. Good breakfast.

name: Camp at the beach
description:
A really nice wild camping site at the beach of the nice and small village, Guasasa. 
The road from Playa Giron is really nice by bike. Many spot to stop for a bath or a night close to the amazing see.
Luis from the «  casa particular » just in front the beach in Guasasa is such a nice guy and told us that’s super safe to camp here even his hostel was empty! 
You can find some diner here too but no shop.

name: Cayo Jutias
description: beautiful beach with lots of space to camp and robinson feeling. on weekends busy but everyone is leaving before nightfall. nearby restaurants and bars for food and drinks. lots of moscitos during rainy season.

name: Villa Jardin Yusniel y Lida - Awesome view!
description: A wonderfully friendly young couple own this place. A basic room with two beds but nice bathroom and really good hot shower. The view from the small patio is great - hills, tobacco fields, drying barn and workers. The breakfast is also really nice. To top it off we paid just 15 CUC. Highly recommended.

name: Yane House
description:
Private home run by Yane.
very friendly, speaks English as well. Room is clean and has A/C.

name: Hostal Weber
description:
A nice new hostal with a garage at Salvador Cisneros #155.
Simple, clean, friendly people. 
Good location in the center of town.

name: Casa Heydi en la Montaña
description:
Heydi the owner runs a nice little casa with a couple of rooms. She speaks English too and can organise trips to the nearby park.
Breakfast and dinner can be provided. a room cost me 15CUC.
motorcycles can be parked on the property, but if it's big and heavy it might be more of a challenge riding it up and down into the garden.

name: 2 hermanos
description:
Spotted a casa with private parking. 
Had some trouble finding one myself and my bike ended up in someone's living room, but thought I'd share this one.

name: Villa "El Pescador"
description:
Nice hostal, friendly people ('Syviadis" offered me her laundromat for washing clothes). Very clean bedrooms (available for 10 - 20 CUC) and delicious food (especially the fish plate).
Only 5 minutes walk to the Beach, where you can find some shade under Mangrove trees.
Nice to hang out for a while!

Contact:
Phone: 55460925 (in Cuba, Puerto Esperanza)
E-Mail: siviadys.cuella@nauta.cu

name: Villa "El Pescador"
description:
Nice hostel, approx. 200 m away from the beach, where you can relax in the shade of the mangroves and swim in the clean water (I have seen a really big sea star!). Very delicious food (especially the fish plate, because the owner is a fisherman!).
They even let me use their laundromat for free!
Prices for rooms range from 10 to 20 CUC.
Reservation contact:
Siviadys y Joel David Fernandez 
Phone: 55460925
Mail: Siviadys.cuella82@nauta.cu

name: Bar
description:
The small bar in the middle of 2 restaurant is the best. 
just sándwich to eat but coconut, fruit, beer, cocktail at good price and the guy is very friendly

name: casa anay y jesus
description:
Best view in Viñales!
The house "casa particular" is in front of a field with spetacular panorama of mogotes and all the valley, sunrise and sunset are superb.
Place is clean, brand new bathroom, quiet, fan and a-c, good breakfast, añso offer dinner at "viñales prices" 4 to 10 cup but i found a local place for eat at 1.
In low season if you speak spanish is possibile to pay just 10cup but also 15 is a deal.

name: Beach camp
description:
This is the first free place to camp after playa larga.
Dirt road and nice beach, some trash.
If you check the low tide times you can probably pitch your tent on the second beach in front of the lagunas.
Good swim, because of the river water at the bottom is warm and cold at top.
Met some nice guy fishing at sunset.

name: WiFi 1CUC / 1h
description:
Get WiFi here for 1 CUC / 1h.
The small tienda is located on the south side of parque trillo. You need your passport to buy the cards (max 3 allowed per person)

name: Casa Manolito y Nory
description:
We normally don‘t add the casa‘s here in Cuba on iOverlander but we really really enjoyed this one so here it goes:
You get the whole upper floor to yourselfs which includes: 2 beds for 3 ppl, AC, double windows for air circulation (we didnt need ac in late december), good shower (our previous casa‘s had really low water pressure, this one was nice), a second room with rocking chairs and a fridge with minibar, two separate terrasses with chairs and table (one on the roof). The location is great, you are in the middle of the center. 
We paid 25cuc but it was around new years eve and everything was booked so maybe you can haggle the price. For 5cuc more per person we got a huge breakfast which no restaurant near us could beat for the price.
Also, Manolito the owner is a hilarious and honest guy, even if you dont speak much spanish you will get a kick out of it.
Totally recommended.
Adress is Gustavo Izquierdo 41
Mail from the owner: manuel.lagunilla@nauta.cu
Phone: 41994299

name: hostal orishas
description:
nice hostal near the center.
20 CUC for room with 3 beds. 
5 CUC breakfast. 
excellent secure parking.
calle 51 c/e 54y54

name: wifi
description:
smal placa with wifi. not free! 
look for the ETECSA office and buy your card.
wifi is fast!

name: lake side
description:
campside next to the lake.
go past the old hotel and open and close the fence.
may you have to talk to the guard.

name: motorcycle parking
description:
official motorcycle parking.
5 pesos national per night.

name: Nicho Waterfall
description: Beautiful waterfalls where you can take a bath. Next to El Nicho, down to the left if you are coming from Cienfuegos. No entry fee and we had the spot for ourselves. You could also camp here. Enjoy :)

name: Las Clavellinas
description: They call it "camping" but you sleep in small huts. Expect nothing special, it's very basic but cheap. We paid 120 COP. and had space for 3 persons. On a friday night there was loud boom boom music 'till 2 am.

name: Embalse El Yeso
description: We wanted to camp at the official campesina but they refused to let us in. So we set up our tent right next to it. Beautiful place at the laguna and quiet at night. Some local horse riders came in the morning but they didn't bother.

name: Casa Andrés y Mary
description:
Very good option for Viñales. Andrés and Mary are super welcoming hosts. The Casa has big and clean rooms with double and single beds and private bathrooms. Very good and huge meals for breakfast and dinner (not included but highly recommended) . Big Parking lot for cars and motorcycles.
5 cuc pppn.

name: Hostal D'cordero
description:
Very lovely hotel. Nice ambiente. Friendly people. 25 coc for room with 3 beds.
Parking near by.

name: Batabano
description:
Good spot for camping.
Talk to the guard and they let you camp.
Had a very quiet night.

name: Corrazon del Mundo
description: Probably the cheapest option to stay in Havanna. Very basic but clean rooms and a very nice rooftop terrace. Small kitchen for guests. 15 Cuc for 2 persons. 25 cuc for 5 persons. Parking next door 5 cuc per night, probably negotiable.

name: Gas station scammers
description:
Be careful at this gas station. They told our friends, the pump is broken and the "especial"-gasoline is inside the 84 octane pump (probably it wasn't). Then the guy from the station filled up and told them it's 40 cuc (should have been around 20 cuc for especial) 
Pay in advance and fill by yourself, like it is normal in Cuba and let them give you a receipt.

name: playa amarilla
description: good spot for camping. may you have to ask the locals. not many people around.

name: In the mangroves
description:
probably the only place to camp on varadero right next to the sea.
a lot of trash and noise of the road and the city.  There was no on around!

name: fast food
description:
it says abierto 24 hours.
local prices.
taste was ok.

name: fast food
description: not the one in the front! the one in the back has local prices.

name: cenote
description:
cristal clear water. 
bring your snorkeling mask.
also good for camping.

name: enigma de las rocas
description:
here is the entrance for the enigma de la rocas trail.
nice walk true through the forest.
you can spot some animals.

name: Coppelia
description: The local ice cream chain. All locals come here, it's fun to watch them. If you want to blend in, you have to order at least three big cups each ;)

name: Casa del Cheff
description:
Good local Restaurant with fish, meat and chicken dishes. 
Dishes from 40 to 110 CUP
Bistec de cerdo 40 CUP
Lomo de cerdo 60 CUP
Camarones 110 CUP

name: Beach road
description: This road follows along the ocean. There are maybe 6 excellent camp spots right on the beach and are in the mangroves out of the sun. a little trash from locals but so remote, not that bad. I was camping from my motorcycle.

name: Beach East of Gitmo
description:
Moderator Note: The User did not apparently stay the night. Please check the situation carefully before setting up for overnight. 

Did not camp here as too early in day. But perfect spot for tent camping with huge sandy beach. There looks to be a bar of a sort at the entrance to road but closed due to Covid. Take road all the way to the end for best access. I am on my motorcycle-  tent camping.

name: Cascorro Wifi
description:
Wifi signal in the park with shady park benches. Decently fast. 

I'm not sure if there's anywhere nearby to buy an ETECSA card.

name: Casa Particular Mileidy y Papo
description:
Top notch Casa Particular. Superbly clean. Great views. Spacious, covered outdoor patio.

Two rooms are available. Each room will sleep four. I traveled solo. Cost for me was US$25 per night, plus US$10 for dinner and US$5 for breakfast. Excellent food.

Street parking for cars/vans. Room in the carport for a motorbike or two. 

Hot water. Air conditioning. 

Responds quickly to WhatsApp messages. +53 5 3642623

name: Roadside
description: When you get to Siboney take the road out of town west. Soon it will be a dirt road rolling along the coast. Lots of spots to camp with some in the mangroves. Only issue I had was the crabs came out at night and made a bunch of noise. Still a great spot. Camping off my motorcycle.

name: Cotilla Spring Water
description:
Natural flowing spring. This was a welcome site as drinking water was hard to find when I was in Cuba. 

Looked clean. Had no odors. So I took a chance and filled up two 1.5 liter bottles and suffered no ill effects. 

Even if you don't drink it, it's a nice place to stop for a bit.

name: Road end for tent near ocean
description: Quait place, for tent with car, ocean voice, no peoples, little basura

name: Near road and ocean
description: Quait place for o e night on the beach. Street light lighting all night, nobody ask us.

name: Playa iOverlander
description: Quait windy place, for one or two nights. Possible to buy tunas in Boca de Canasi, up from Puerto Libri, 150cup per kg.

name: Casa leo
description:
Beautiful and cozy place where you can get in touch with nature and explore a beautiful valley and mountains. 

———————————————————————————-

Lugar hermoso y acojedor en el cual puede ponerse en contacto con la naturaleza y axeder a un hermoso valle y montañas

name: Hostal Finca Aurora
description:
Havana, Artemisa Province, Cuba

3 queen beds, 1 double bed, Sleeps 2
Is listed on Airbnb as well $25 a night 
Ask for David or Maday

name: Comida Criolla
description: First of all, Comida Criolla has gotten very good food for a fair price. I befriended the owner a little bit the past day. When i missed my bus this evening I told him that i was going to have dinner and look for a spot to camp in the wild. without hesitation he told me that I could set up camp next to his place. i dont know if this has happened before.

name: Trinidad Colonial
description:
a well know Restaurant in a colonial building, the prices are aroun 1,80$ and 2,50$...we try several dishes and the one we liked the most was Ropa Vieja, there are chicken, pork, beef and Salmon (it wasnt that good the salmon).
drinks are a bit more "expensive" juices 1$, cocktails 2,50$
high recommended!

name: Alicia Marin local house
description:
We stayed at a particular house, close to the city center, the family was so nice and gave us good advices, we negotiated the price and get on apartment for 5 person, small but enough for us, breakfast was big and good too!
hostalaliciaymiguel@gmail.com
+53 52252660
+53 55489093

tap water was potable.

in the pictures you will find the business card with more info!

name: La Perla
description:
Goverment restaurant, the menu with main and dessert was between 1,60$ and 3$ there was several meat options and extra portion to add if want it.
the food was good!

name: Martha casa particular
description:
Local house that rent rooms near the train station, they only have 2 rooms, we stayed in one for 10$ (after negotiated).
Nice and clean with fan and air conditioning, the family was friendly.
Photo of the street attached, in front of Hotel plaza.

name: Local house
description:
Casa Particular in a colonial house close to the center. We rent a room for four,it was low season so we got a good deal 10$ for the room but expect to be between 10 and 20$.
to eat in the house was overpriced, we eat outsite but it was difficult to find restaurants open and we good price!
find attached a picture of the house

name: Cañón de Yurumí
description:
The Canyon is a protected area around 30km from Baracoa, there area  few hikes and a short boat ride in the river, the hikes were around 250 (2,50$) and if you want only the boat will be 50 (0,50$).
There is a waterfall too.
We enjoyed the journey and the swing in the river, and a nice day hiking.
We took a "Maquina" in the local terminal there were more locals taking it to go to Maisí, it was around 150 each.

name: Casa particular la Moderna (Ysabel)
description:
We had a nice stay with Ysabel and her husband, they were very helpful and the house is central, they have at least 4 rooms to rent, we stayed in one with 2 double beds (we were 4), with air conditioning and private toilet, there was a share living room and balcony only for the guest and a big terrace upstairs.
We came for a couple of days and stay 5 nights...Highly recommended!
there are some more contact detais attached in the pictures but in case you don't get much internet their number is 21643515
54187374 (mobile)

name: La casona
description: Restaurant of the state in a very nice building and close to the terminal if you are going to viñales with the Camion is a good option...prices around 0.65$ and 2,50$ dolars, chicken, pork and beef, salad, vianda and rice.

name: Campismo Dos Hermanas
description:
It is a government "campsite" (it's more like little houses).  We didn't ask for the price but in another place we asked and it's around 2$ so it's worth it to ask if you want to stay surrounded by nature and do the hiking around.
We stopped to have small pizza for 0,25$ and piña colada 0,50$. there was a swimming pool and another restaurant with meals but it wasn't open because low season.
I recommend it!

name: Casa de Don Tomas
description:
Government restaurant, we tryed delicias de Don tomas (kind of paella), chicken, prawns and it was good between 1,50$ and 2$, there was Langosta for 3,5$ that we didn't try but looks good.
Mojito and Cuba libre 0,60$.
plus Live music...very nice place to eat!

name: Callejon Hamel
description: Sunday's live music at midday at the callejon...recommended!!

name: Cafeteria Lluvia de oro
description:
Government restaurant, we had chicken with rice 90 cup (0,90$), soup 50, mojito 50, beer 125 500ml (the cheapest I have seen)
it was tasty and very cheap compare with the touristic restaurants...
I had being putting this kind of restaurant's through my trip in Cuba in differents cities if you want to eat for less than 2-3 dolars have a look!

name: Silda guest house
description:
They have 4 rooms to rent, we stayed in one for 3 people with privat toilet, very friendly couple, they were offering small breakfast and wifi.
Good location no far from the Habana vieja and museums.
in maps.me appears at Silda house

tel: 8621314 / 053875271
marlenerlos@nauta.cu

name: Casa Raquel
description:
Very nice Casa Particular. All Rooms with Aircondition, bathroom with hot water and TV. 
1 Night 25$ per room

name: Etecsa
description:
Here you can buy WIFI Cards. You need your Passport and pay in cash. 
You have a WIFI spot in the park

name: Juan's casa
description: very basic room but extremely cheap: 150 CUP in 2024. Very kind owners

name: Casa Juana y Enrique
description:
informal restaurant. very good food and generous portions. dishes for 1500 pesos (Feb 2024) including rice and fried plantain.

They allowed me to pitch my tent opposite their house. there is a flat grass area and, if it rains, a concrete elevated platform with roof.

they also offer accommodation but not sure about the price.

Nearby natural pool to swim in the river.
Perfect spot to start the Yunque climb early in the morning (I left my bike at the restaurant)

name: Hotel Miramar
description:
very basic hotel but good and very cheap.
In Feb 2024: room for 300 pesos and dinner, quite good, for 900 including 2 beers

name: Manantiales Del Ocujal
description: cheap accommodation: in Feb 2024 it 250cup for room with 2 double beds. dinner for 500. nice setting, decent food, terrible bathroom

name: Casa Colonial Los Balcones
description: It is a Casa Particular that invites you to feel at home. It is located in the center and from the many balconies on two sides you can watch the hustle and bustle on the streets. The family is very friendly and helpful. The accommodation is also inexpensive. The owner is a fair taxi driver. He will also take you to the airport, for example. The rooms are clean and well furnished. A good starting point for the city of Havana.
